>
>Take a step back and you don't need to handle this via headers, just
>support the xpath expression within the URI, probably in the fragment,
>e.g.
>
>PUT /foo.xml#//root/child[@attribute='value']
>
>no black magic or obscure header usage required.
>

Only a client that sends fragments as part of the request...  ;-)

We generate XPointer URLs on the server, for client consumption as 
XPointer is implemented using XPath in the fragment.  But on the 
server side you need to make an "XPointer query" URL:

PUT /foo.xml?xpointer=//root/child/text()

-Eric
